1.brief: physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, perhaps to separate, i.e. distinguish (literally or figuratively); by implication, to be (causatively, make) great, difficult, wonderful

2.brief: probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
to jump for joy, i.e. exult
play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
an elevation, i.e. (adj.) lofty (compar.); as title, the Supreme

3.brief: to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
the hinder part; hence (adverb) behind, backward; also (as facing north) the West
to totter or waver (through weakness of the legs, especially the ankle); by implication, to falter, stumble, faint or fall
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

4.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
judgement (the suit, justice, sentence or tribunal); by implication also strife
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
properly, covered, i.e. a throne (as canopied)
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity

5.brief: a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
properly, to stroke or rub; by implication, to erase; also to smooth (as if with oil), i.e. grease or make fat; also to touch, i.e. reach to
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
properly, a (peremptory) terminus, i.e. (by implication) duration, in the sense of advance or perpetuity (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition)

6.brief: to complete, in a good or a bad sense, literal, or figurative, transitive or intransitive
properly, drought, i.e. (by implication) a desolation

properly, a goal, i.e. the bright object at adistance travelled towards; hence (figuratively), splendor, or (subjectively) truthfulness, or (objectively) confidence; but usually (adverbially), continually (i.e. to the most distant point of view)
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
a memento, abstractly recollection (rarely if ever); by implication, commemoration

7.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
properly, covered, i.e. a throne (as canopied)

8.brief: he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
the earth (as moist and therefore inhabited); by extension, the globe; by implication, its inhabitants; specifically, a particular land, as Babylonia, Palestine
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity
a straight course, i.e. sail direct
evenness, i.e. (figuratively) prosperity or concord; also straightness, i.e. (figuratively) rectitude (only in plural with singular sense; often adverbially)

9.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
defence, high fort (tower), refuge, Misgab, a place in Moab
defence, high fort (tower), refuge, Misgab, a place in Moab
time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.
tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival:

10.brief: figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to loosen, i.e. relinquish, permit, etc.
properly, to tread or frequent; usually to follow (for pursuit or search); by implication, to seek or ask; specifically to worship
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

11.brief: play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem

properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
an exploit (of God), or a performance (of man, often in a bad sense); by implication, an opportunity

12.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to tread or frequent; usually to follow (for pursuit or search); by implication, to seek or ask; specifically to worship
blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention

13.brief: properly, to bend or stoop in kindness to an inferior; to favor, bestow; causatively to implore (i.e. move to favor by petition)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
an opening, i.e. door or gate
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin

14.brief: properly, heed, i.e. purpose; used only adverbially, on account of (as a motive or an aim), teleologically, in order that
properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
an opening, i.e. door or gate
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
properly, to spin round (under the influence of any violent emotion), i.e. usually rejoice, or (as cringing) fear
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity

15.brief: a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
a pit (especially as a trap); figuratively, destruction
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
to catch (in a net, trap or pit); generally, to capture or occupy; also to choose (by lot); figuratively, to cohere
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda

16.brief: to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power
to entrap (with a noose), literally or figuratively
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
a murmuring sound, i.e. a musical notation (probably similar to the modern affettuoso to indicate solemnity of movement); by implication, a machination

17.brief: to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
Hades or the world of the dead (as if a subterranean retreat), including its accessories and inmates
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

18.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

properly, a goal, i.e. the bright object at adistance travelled towards; hence (figuratively), splendor, or (subjectively) truthfulness, or (objectively) confidence; but usually (adverbially), continually (i.e. to the most distant point of view)
to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention
literally a cord (as an attachment); figuratively, expectancy
depressed (figuratively), in mind (gentle) or circumstances (needy, especially saintly)
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
properly, a (peremptory) terminus, i.e. (by implication) duration, in the sense of advance or perpetuity (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition)

19.brief: to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
a man in general (singly or collectively)
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

20.brief: to place (in a very wide application)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
fear; by implication, a fearful thing or deed

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

a man in general (singly or collectively)
